name: Hilton Prague

reviews.title: Excellent Hotel - Will stay here again!
reviews.text: I stayed here in June 2005 and a party of 6 of us shared 2 triple rooms. The rooms were larger then expected and we had an atrium view which was brilliant. One of the best showers I have used in a hotel. The hotel is situated a little outside the city but if you dont mind a 15 minute walk (tops) along the river bank and admire the decorative buildings and flowing river and amazing floodlit castle views then dont bother going to Prague - it will be wasted on you. However, you will need good flat shoes! Many streets are cobbeled and you can do a lot of walking.

reviews.title: Great comfortable hotel, great service, average location
reviews.text: The hotel has a huge bar with the largest selection of Vodka i have ever seen. It has a 24hr restaurant which we did take advantage of at 4am with a hot bowl of french soup with large croutons covered in melted gruyerre cheese, a large cup of hot chocolate and a large slice of solid choloclate cake - all for £8 which wasnt bad at all.

reviews.title: short stay
reviews.text: Our room rates were excellent, having got a deal for £55 each from Airmiles i was chuffed to bits. Staff were friendly, consierge friendly and very helpful, let us store our bags all afternoon on the final day and arranged for our taxi.

reviews.title: great hotel-poor location
reviews.text: Also, we had full use of the excellent pool which although a little cool was refreshing. Jaccuzi, a sauna and steam room. all for free. I also took advantage of a 1hr massage session for £20 which took all my aches away.

reviews.title: mixed feelings about the Prague Hilton
reviews.text: We were there for 4 days and had a brillaint time, walking around and totalling up over 30 miles in walking. Castle is a must, the astronomical clock, and Lavka bar jutting out by the main weir and an outside seated area.
I decided to walk from the city centre to the Hilton. But had to turn back and take a big detour because I couldn't get past the major highway. Not really close to anything.
reviews.title: Poor Location and Distance to Elevator

reviews.text: Added to this I was the victim of a bogus policeman scam on the way back to the hotel. Luckily my lonely planet guide warned me of this and I managed to come out with all my money.
reviews.title: Pleasant Stay

reviews.text: The hotel is setup in an atrium style and my room a happened to be about 2 minutes walk from the elevator.
reviews.title: Prague Hilton - what a letdown (and ripoff!)
Hilton Prague is exceptional!
reviews.text: We had a very enjoyable stay here. The hotel is much like you would expect from a Hilton in terms of decoration. The room was spacious, clean and well layed out. The staff were pleasant. One bonus was the spa which was great (except for a couple of rather corpulent male guests ignoring the sign asking for guests to remain covered by a towel when in the sauna/steam room!!). The treatments were very relaxing and well received after a days sightseeing. The hotel is not right in the city centre but it is within an easy walk to much of the city and the Prague metro is incredibly easy to use.
We stayed at Prague Hilton for 3 nights and were extremely disappointed - we had expected much, as we had stayed at another Hilton during our trip - in Bucharest- and it was excellent.
reviews.title: Great!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked the Hilton on their website as a place to stay while getting
reviews.title: Great stay, excellent service

likes.liked: — Fantastic service, very nice looking hotel inside

reviews.text: married in Prague in September 2006. On arrival at the hotel we asked
reviews.title: Great Place to stay but smokey lobby at times

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: to upgrade and got booked into an executive junior suite. The check in itself was fairly quick.
reviews.title: Outstanding Service and Room

likes.disliked: — Sound Proofing of Room (minor issue) and Location

reviews.text: When we got to the room we weren't disappointed. The room was excellent, seemed quite new and was well fitted with everything we could want including two large LCD TVs. The furnishings were very good aswell.
reviews.title: bait & fool

reviews.text: We got the use of the executive lounge with the room which, as it turned out, really made the stay worthwhile. Although we only had a few days in the hotel the use of the executive lounge prior to and after the wedding was excellent. You can help yourself to drinks and snacks, free of charge, from the lounge as needed. Drinks including whatever you wanted. For my wife this was excellent and the service she received on the wedding morning for her and her family was nothing short of phenomenal. It provided not only someone to wait while the wedding party changed but also the staff were very attentive of our guests who weren't even staying at the hotel. They topped it off by providing a bottle of champagne prior to their departure. This continued for the whole stay so can really recommend it for wedding parties.
reviews.title: Excellent Service
what a breakfast
reviews.text: I stayed with my parents for 7 days and i would say it was regular. We paid very litlle for it so to stay in a hilton 5 star hotel was a pleasure. however my bad was very bad as it should be a triple guest room but it had a king size bed and a small bed like those for children.... well the breakfast was amasing and the products served with a great quality. the staff was very polite and helpful and by the subway it is very easy to get to all the important parts of the city. near you have a macdonalds, kfc and a small shopping centre that you should discover. enjoy prague and its beautiful features

Having got a cheap deal online my partner & I stayed 5 nights. Staff very nicely changed our twin to a double without any hassle and we found service to be very good. We were glad breafast was included because at €22 it was steep... very nice for all inclusive though. The swimming pool is cold, small, and too deep for relaxing - not good for children or loungers.
reviews.title: Good if you get it on the cheap!

reviews.text: Fixed price taxis outside are still a ripoff though are safer than negotiating in town at night. When walking out at night take the route via the metro station - avoid walking by the river even though staff don't make a big deal of it. The hotel is in a bad part of town. Tourists returning at night are conspicuous. Location takes greatly from enjoyment of old town prague. Ask for a room with an external window. Rooms overlooking the atrium are stuffy and noisy when window opened. Sample a 'romantic prague' from the cocktail list.. yummy. Bar staff are very nice. Had a nice stay there but would have been disappointed if I'd paid more than €50 a night.
reviews.title: Loved the Hilton

reviews.text: What can I say. Fantastic! We did upgrade to an executive room and its definitely worth the extra. Wonderful spa/fitness facilities. Excellent meals. Drinks in the bar in our oppinion a little pricey but the surroundings are very chilled and relaxing.A bit of a walk into the main town but quite ok for the fit and healthy. The staff couldnt do enough for us. We will be back!! One of the nicest hotels we have stopped in for a long while. Hilton at its best.
reviews.title: OK, but just

reviews.text: ONLY OK. Located next to busy highway and in the midst of a business district, it's a hike to the tourist area and no where to eat/wander at night. A subway stop is 2 blocks away though. Check-in was swift and friendly. We had an unrenovated room, a bit threadbare as others have noted this hotel is simply not 5 star. The bed was totally shot. Bathroom was small, dimly lite and clearly in need to renovation. Rooms sizes are on the small size (considering the space wasted for the atrium). Room was quiet despite location though. Our rate did not include breakfast and we were stung by a charge of US$26 per person for the breakfast buffet. What a rip-off. The buffett area is a mad house with a lot of noise and activity. The buffet itself was only so so and we made this mistake only once. Hotel taxi airport was CZ 890, we arranged our own for CZ 590 (a difference of US$15) -- another rip off. Hotel caters to tourist groups (I used Hilton points for my stay), while nothing horribly negative, there are better choices for the money.
reviews.title: Outstanding service and a nice hotel

reviews.text: OK, this isn't Prague. This is a little piece of America plonked down on the outskirts of Prague's Old Town. As long as you are fine with that, this is an excellent hotel. It does feel a bit strange for a Swede, though.
reviews.title: A little piece of America

likes.disliked: — The walk from the underground station - graffiti and concrete

reviews.title: Nice Hotel - but beware of dubious exchange rates
reviews.text: The restaurant serves American beef, there are bagels for breakfast, and everyone addresses you in English. The only thing that gives it away is the accent of the staff, the pickled onions in the breakfast buffet, and the taste of the beer (good).
The staff's courtesies do seem a bit nervous and rehearsed, but they also seem earnestly eager to please, and that's what counts in my book.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel, Lacks Local Charm

likes.disliked: — away from the city center, lacks local charm, in-hotel goods are extremely expensive

reviews.text: If I went to Prague on holiday I might look for something a bit more genuine, but on business trips where comfort and simplicity is a priority, this fits the bill perfectly.
reviews.title: Easily my favourite Prague hotel

likes.disliked: — The lifts close too quickly, just a minor niggle

reviews.text: First the negative: I booked on the hotel website, was given a rate in Euros, and a total rate for the whole stay in Euros. But when it came to paying, this was converted to CZK at a very unfavourable rate (the cost increased by about 5% - 761 to 795 EUR). There seemed to be no way to pay the agreed rate - asking to pay in Euros simply provided the higher price.
reviews.title: simply, first class
Excellent hotel, Excellent service
reviews.text: We booked through Opodo for a weekend break, but after reading reviews on here I decided to upgrade to the executive floors directly with the hotel, this was a fantastic decision. From first contact with the hotel, through check in, to queries about restaurants and tours, breakfast, snacks, the clubroom everything was top notch, all for fantastic value for money.

The hotel is no more than a comfy ten minute walk to the old town centre and it has all the facilites you would expect from a top hotel, including a restauarant which cooks one of the best steaks I have ever had.
reviews.title: Very Nice Hotel - Good Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff really make this a quality place to stay, and I could not criticise one of them, however a special mention to the waiting staff in the Czech Grill who decanted the wine beautifully, something you rarely see in hotel restaurants. Also the staff in the clubroom, who were friendly yet not over bearing.
reviews.title: FANTASTIC

reviews.text: Just got back from a holiday weekend in Prague. Mostly good things to say about the Hilton. Very large (Queen) room in the renovated area fit my family nicely. Also got a very nice rate from the Hilton Website. Great service at the hotel! Very Accommodating.
reviews.title: Incredible Stay-can't wait to come back

likes.liked: — The Executive Lounge and Stellar Customer Service

reviews.title: Fabulous New Year Experience
reviews.text: Ate in the restaurant for dinner (Atrium) where the food was great. Breakfast was the Hilton standard, four star fare. Weight room and pool were both in good shape. The casino in the lowest level was much appreciated as well. There was blackjack/poker and much excitement. First time in a European casino - type environment was a bit exotic...

Very nce! My room was newly remodeled and one of the nicest Hilton rooms I have ever been in. Service was excellent - they must have been trained by the Ritz staff! Very attentive and nice. I recommend. Only drawback is that it is a little walk to the sights, but not bad.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel, excellent service

likes.disliked: — Loacation. It was a bit of a walk to get to the sights.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked this hotel on the Hilton web site at the cheapest rate i.e. non refundable and pre-paid which is great if you know you're definitely going to go. From the airport take the 100 Bus to Zlicin then the Metro Yellow Line 14 stops to Florenc. At Florenc exit on Sokolovska and it's only 5 minutes walk. As you've probably guessed we are fortunate enough not to be the typical affluent Hilton type guests so we know how to appreciate public transport and do things within budget.
reviews.title: World Class Hotel - perfect birthday
Luxurious Hotel in Prague
reviews.text: Smooth check-in, we were in the room within 5 minutes of arrival. First of all appreciate the fabulous hotel Atrium. Use the Atrium facing lift if you get a chance. The room was splendid, oozing with 5 star quality: tea/coffee facilities, TV, mini-bar, electronic safe, versatile cupboard and drawer storage, excellent lighting, very comfortable king bed, sofa, air-con, an impressive dressing table that doubled up as a business desk (not that we were there on business), iron, ironing board and hair dryer.

The bathroom was beautifully fitted out. It was actually designed for disabled access and was very aesthetically pleasing unlike disabled bathrooms I have seen in other hotels which are very clumsy and ugly. Huge bath, top quality toiletries, bath robes and lots of flat storage around the sink area.
reviews.title: simply the best

reviews.text: For our needs the hotel location was perfect. Walking distance to the Old Town was about 20 minutes. 10 Minutes to Namesti Republicky. 15-20 minutes to Vaclavske Namesti. Served perfectly by the Florenc metro station as well as night buses and trams through the night (I bet we were the only Hilton guests on the 02:18 number 52 night tram from Vodickova!)
reviews.title: Outstanding Service

likes.liked: — Excellent Service and facilities. Good breakfast.

reviews.text: We were very impressed by the service which was faultless. The staff all spoke excellent English and were friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Excellent service, food and facilities

reviews.text: We dined in a variety of places but the superb service in the Hilton tempted us to eat there more often although it was more expensive.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel and service!
Great place to eat - and not so great - Hilton Hotel
reviews.text: Our room was extremely comfortable but the most impressive feature of the Hilton was the large atrium area which was very comfortable to sit in and relax especially when it was raining outside. A top hatted doorman even lent us his umbrella for a walk to the town square during one of the rainy days.

reviews.title: Excellent Anniversary Weekend
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Hilton Prague in June; we were very impressed with the quality service and amenities! I agree with another review that this hotel deserves a five-star rating. From check-in, to the executive lounge, to dinner at the restaurant, to check-out, everything was top-notch. The staff were genuinely nice to us there; everyone went out of their way to make us feel welcome. We already wrote to the hotel stating how pleased we were with our stay. We will certainly stay there again on our next trip to Prague. Its location is also good, and it is quite close to a metro station.

Just got back from a river cruise trip of eastern Danube river. We finished with 3 days in Prague. We stayed at the Hilton Hotel in Prague. the rooms were part of a tour package, so I can't tell you what we wctually paid, but the hotel was very expensive. My biggest complaints were that you had to pay to make coffe in your own room and housekeeping was poor. One day they never even got a round to cleaning our room ( 5 star hotel). I would not recommend the Hilton. Others suggested the Intercontinential Hotel, which is much closer to the Old town Square. and more places to eat.
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel

description: Hilton Prague is a perfect base to discover the beauties of Prague. It is located within walking distance to the city centre full of local attractions, shops and a lively night scene. Hilton Prague houses 3 restaurants and 2 bars including the 24-hour Café Bistro, CzecHouse Grill & Rotisserie with modern international cuisine and Czech specialties, offers panoramic views from its award-winning Cloud 9 Sky Bar & Lounge, the Zest Bar and 24-hour Room Service. Every morning you can enjoy a rich buffet breakfast at Atrium restaurant. All rooms provide high-speed internet access, with a choice of a wired or wireless connection (Fee applies). A state-of-the-art fitness centre with cardiovascular machines, an indoor swimming pool and a spa centre are at your disposal. Massages are available as well. This hotel offers 37 individual conference and meeting rooms as well as Congress Hall and a Hilton Grand Ballroom, the Hilton Prague Czech Republic hotel is the perfect choice to host any event, whether for business or pleasure. The Hilton Prague Hotel was awarded as Top Responsible Hotel & Restaurant in the Czech Republic, 2013 by Business for the Company Platform; Best Business Hotel in Eastern Europe for four consecutive years, Business Traveller Awards 2013; Best Business Hotel in the Czech Republic, World Travel Awards 2013; Best Business Hotel in the Czech Republic for four consecutive years, Business Destinations Travel Awards 2013; and Best Hotel in the Czech Republic for six consecutive years, TTG Travel Awards 2013.
